title: Is it true that early Christians were baptised naked? - Quora

response.answer_text: So far as we know, and practices may have varied in different local churches, those being baptized were not naked, but clothed in some single cloth vestment and led down into the baptismal pool. There they were plunged three times under the water. They climbed out up the steps, and were led into a side room, changed into a long dry white robe (white being symbolic of purity and new life) and then re-emerged to be chrismated (confirmed). Deaconnesses and godmother assisted the female candidates, deacons and godfathers the male candidates, who of course would have been separated. The early Christians were far more concerned about modesty and decency than many people today are.

Question: Is it true that early Christians were baptised naked? In light of what the Bible teaches, I have to wonder where such a thought could come from. Such a thing would cause all kinds of lustful thinking….NO!
